alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 8:33AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Fresno. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 831 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Around 0.50 inch of rain has fallen. Rainfall rates around 0.25 inch per hour are expected at times. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.50 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Clovis and Calwa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
